xyz.swatt.xml

Class XmlDocumentHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.swatt.xml.XmlDocumentHelper

  • public final class
                    XmlDocumentHelper
                    extends
                    Object
    A Helper Class to deal with XML Document s.
    • XML: W3C is used for all XML Classes.
    • XPath: Saxon s9api is used to support XPath v3.1.
    Author:
    Brandon Dudek (BrandonDudek)

      • createElementNode

        public static Node createElementNode(Document _xmlDocument,
                                    String _name,
                                    String _value)
        Creates an Element Node , that belongs to the given XML Document , with the given name and value.
        Parameters:
        _xmlDocument - The XML Document to be the owner of this new Node .
        _name - The name to call the new Node.
        _value - The value to give the new Node.
        Returns:
        The Node that was just created.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given XML Document isnull, or if the given Name or Value is blank.

      • decimalEscapedToHexEscaped

        public static String decimalEscapedToHexEscaped(
                                    String _s)
        Finds all Decimal Entities with the equivalent Hexadecimal Entity.
        Parameters:
        _s - The String to perform the find and replace on.
        Returns:
        The given String with the replacements made.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given string is blank.

      • createNewDocument

        public static Document createNewDocument()
        Will create a new XML Document .
        Returns:
        A brand new, empty XML Document , with no root.
        Throws:
        XmlException - If the Document cannot be created.

      • escapeExtendedCharacters

        public static String escapeExtendedCharacters(
                                    String _inputString,
                                    XmlDocumentHelper.XmlEntityFormat _format)
        Will XML Escape any character outside of the range of Basic Latin printable characters (\x09-\x0D|\x21-\x7E). (Note: Same as only keeping ASCII printable characters.)
        Parameters:
        _inputString - The String to parse for escaping.
        _format - Whether the XML Entities should be in Decimal or HEX format.
        Returns:
        The escaped String ; ornull, if null is given.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given XmlDocumentHelper.XmlEntityFormat is null or an unknown format.

      • getDocumentFrom

        public static Document getDocumentFrom(File _xmlFile)
        Creates a Namespace aware XML Document from an XML File .
        Parameters:
        _xmlFile - An XML File to parse into an XML Document .
        Returns:
        An XML Document representing the given File.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • If the given File isnull.
        • The given File does not exist.
        • The given File is a directory.
        • Or the given File is unreadable.
        XmlException - If there was a problem with conversion.

      • getDocumentFrom

        public static Document getDocumentFrom(String _xmlString)
        Creates a Namespace aware XML Document from a String representation.
        Parameters:
        _xmlString - String representation of an XML Document .
        Returns:
        An XML Document representing the given String.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • If the given String isnull.
        • Or if the given String is Empty or just Whitespace.
        XmlException - If there was a problem with conversion.

      • getNodeForXPath

        public static Node getNodeForXPath(Node _xmlNode,
                                    String _xPath)
        Gets a Node from a given XML Document that match the given XPath. (Expects only 1 Node to be found.)

        If an XPath boolean (xs:boolean) is given as the XPath, it will be wrapped in an #TEXT Node and returned.

        Note: All Root level Namespaces are automatically accounted for and do not have to be manually specified.

        Parameters:
        _xmlNode - The Document or Element to do the XPath search on.

        Even if an Node is passed, the search could still be at the Document level depending on the _xPath value.

        _xPath - The XPath to search for.

        If the XPath starts with "/" or "//" the search will be done at the Document level.

        If the XPath starts with no backslash, "./", or ".//" the search will be done at the Element level. (When searching from the Element level, do not include the given element's name in the XPath.)

        Returns:
        A Node that was the result of this XPath lookup, ornull, if no Node matches the XPath expression.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given Node is null or the given XPath is blank.
        XmlException - If there is an error with the XPath lookup.
        TooManyResultsException - If more than 1 Node was found by the given XPath

      • getNodesForXPath

        public static List<Node> getNodesForXPath(Node _xmlNode,
                                    String _xPath)
        Gets a list of Node s from a given XML Document that match the given XPath.

        If an XPath boolean (xs:boolean) is given as the XPath, it will be wrapped in an #TEXT Node and returned.

        Note: All Root level Namespaces are automatically accounted for and do not have to be manually specified.

        Parameters:
        _xmlNode - The Document or Element to do the XPath search on.

        Even if an Node is passed, the search could still be at the Document level depending on the _xPath value.

        _xPath - The XPath to search for.

        If the XPath starts with "/" or "//" the search will be done at the Document level.

        If the XPath starts with no backslash, "./", or ".//" the search will be done at the Element level. (When searching from the Element level, do not include the given element's name in the XPath.)

        Returns:
        A collection of Node s that was the result of this XPath lookup, or an empty collection, if no Node s matched the XPath expression.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given Node is null or the given XPath is blank.
        XmlException - If there is an error with the XPath lookup.

      • getStringForXPath

        public static String getStringForXPath(Node _xmlNode,
                                    String _xPath)
        Gets a String result for the given xPath, by calling getTextContent() on the returned element.

        Note: All Root level Namespaces are automatically accounted for and do not have to be manually specified.

        Parameters:
        _xmlNode - The Document or Element to do the XPath search on.
        • Even if an Element is passed, the search could still be at the Document level depending on the _xPath value.
        _xPath - The XPath to search for.
        • If the XPath Starts with "/" or "//" the search will be done at the Document level.
        • If the XPath Starts with "./" or no backslash the search will be done at the Element level.
          • When Searching from the Element Level, do not include the given element's name in the XPath.
        Returns:
        A String with the result or NULL, if there is no result.
        Throws:
        XmlException - If there is an error with the XPath lookup.
        TooManyResultsException - If more than 1 Node was found by the given XPath

      • getStringsForXPath

        public static List<String> getStringsForXPath(
                                    Node _xmlNode,
                                    String _xPath)
        Gets a List of String results for the given xPath, by calling getTextContent() on all of the returned Elements.

        Note: All Root level Namespaces are automatically accounted for and do not have to be manually specified.

        Parameters:
        _xmlNode - The Document or Element to do the XPath search on.
        • Even if an Element is passed, the search could still be at the Document level depending on the _xPath value.
        _xPath - The XPath to search for.
        • If the XPath Starts with "/" or "//" the search will be done at the Document level.
        • If the XPath Starts with "./" or no backslash the search will be done at the Element level.
          • When Searching from the Element Level, do not include the given element's name in the XPath.
        Returns:
        A List of Strings with the result or an Empty List, if there is no result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given Node is null or the given XPath is blank.
        XmlException - If there is an error with the XPath lookup.

      • hexEscapedToDecimalEscaped

        public static String hexEscapedToDecimalEscaped(
                                    String _s)
        Finds all Hexadecimal Entities with the equivalent Decimal Entity.
        Parameters:
        _s - The String to perform the find and replace on.
        Returns:
        The given String with the replacements made.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given string is blank.

      • htmlToXml

        public static Document htmlToXml(String _html)
        Will take in an HTML String and try to parse it to an XML Document , with UTF-8 encoding.

        (The parsing will try to resolve the differences between HTML and XML.)

        Note: All tags and attributes are converted to lower case, for consistency.

        Warning: If the given text does not have a root element, then only the first element is parsed..

        Parameters:
        _html - The HTML String to convert to an XML Document .
        Returns:
        The given HTML as an XML Document .
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given HTML String is blank.
        XmlException - If the given HTML String cannot be parsed or has multiple root elements.

      • prettyPrint

        public static String prettyPrint(Node _node)
        Takes in an XML Node and returns a String XML representation of it, with no formatting.
        Parameters:
        _node - The Node/Document to get the String representation of.
        Returns:
        The XML Node / Document in String format
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given _node isnull.
        XmlException - If the Node / Document cannot be converted into a String.

      • toString

        public static String toString(Node _node)
        Takes in an XML Node and returns a String XML representation of it, with no formatting.
        Parameters:
        _node - The Node/Document to get the String representation of.
        Returns:
        The XML Node / Document in String format
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given _node isnull.
        XmlException - If the Node / Document cannot be converted into a String.

      • toString

        public static String toString(Node _node,
                                    boolean _prettyPrint)
        Takes in an XML Node and returns a String XML representation of it.
        Parameters:
        _node - The Node/Document to get the String representation of.
        _prettyPrint - Whether or not to apply "pretty print" to the String. (The indent value will be 2 spaces.)
        Returns:
        The XML Node / Document in String format.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given _node isnull.
        XmlException - If the Node / Document cannot be converted into a String.
